intro: Euphrasia curta var. ostenfeldii, commonly known as the Ostenfeld's narrow-fruited eyebright, is a low-growing herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers that bloom in early summer. The plant typically features hairy stems and oval-shaped leaves with a serrated edge. It thrives in moist, shady environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its scientific name reflects its distinct morphology and geographic origin.
